reviews.review: Half Life is a fun (somewhat frustrating) game which gave birth to an amazing game series by valve which we are all wanting more of, this game presents challenge and a lot of good moments, funny and annoying.

I have been hearing about Half-Life for a very long time and just finished playing. Got to say - I liked it a lot, all the people recommending this series haven't been wrong so far. Here's to hoping I will enjoy sequels as much and more!
e o pula de cal. da imi place
Great game, doesn't feel as linear as it is

Not only is it amazing that Half-Life is over 21 years old now, it continues to remain a fun and entertaining game despite its dated graphics. In my opinion at least, the fact that you can get up to 15 hours of gameplay out of a game that now costs $1 (if you get it on sale) and can virtually run on anything today makes it a must have for any PC game library. Excellent for road trips, flights, or anywhere else where computing power is limited and you want to game. Not to mention, it has a much longer Half-Life 2 to follow it.

В детстве мне не удалось поиграть в 1 HL (поэтому никаких ностальгических чувств у меня к ней нет). Да и после появления собственного ПК, 2 часть HL мне понравилась больше.
Сюжет вполне нормальный. Геймлей таков - Фримен нажми на кнопку, толкай тележку, води за собой охранников или ученых, убивай гребаных вояк и пришельцев  ( п.c. вояки на последней сложности имеют жирное ХП и повышенную точность метания гранат ). К середине игры я ощутил резкую нехватку патронов и здоровья. Поэтому приходилось использовать всю свою смекалку, загружая сейвы снова и снова. В игре два неприятных момента, и все они находятся в измерении xen. Матка хеткрабов и босс Нихилант. Если Нихиланта я еще как-то осилил, то эту курву с огромным брюхом я проклинал довольно долго. Всем советую 9/10.

This is a review of the [spoiler]leaked Beta[/spoiler] Dreamcast version of the game. Keep in mind that some aspects of this review may [b]only[/b] apply to [i]that[/i] version of the game:
[h1]Premise[/h1]
Stop me if you heard this before: [spoiler]normal day at work, science experiment blows up in your face, alien invasion, military trying to cover it up[/spoiler]; there's really no other flow or context to the story other than the game pushing you along to first escape and, then, "contain" the situation; anyone that thinks that "interactive cutscenes" are good are idiots; the ending is [spoiler]the glow-in-the-dark CIAyys declaring that you helped give them complete control of everything, and he gives you the option of being "employed" under him or becoming Doom[/spoiler]; the Blue Shift EP details a security guard trying to escape; [spoiler]also G Man is a meme[/spoiler]
[h1]Audiovisuals[/h1]
Graphics are rather flat and plain; wish there was a little more variety in the environmental details ([i]BS[/i] doesn't have that much of a problem); enemy aliens all look like they're origami; Xen is actually the best designed levels; game actually does look good for a two/three year later "remaster" of a game from '98, FPS consistency bounces around like a pinball ([spoiler]Dreamcast exclusive problem[/spoiler]); music is rather cheesy or cliche, other audio is too loud to hear much of anything that the NPCs are saying
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Standard linear, corridor shooter FPS; best gameplay moments are the platforming or progressing to the next area by solving "puzzles"; game gives you the "you win" grunt gun early on; enemies can be killed in a single file line by just funneling them through a door; actually killing the enemies never really feels fun (Even when not exploiting the game's AI); save features are completely buggy and can destroy any groove that you have ([spoiler]Dreamcast exclusive problem[/spoiler])
[h1]Consensus[/h1]
[b]Is [i]Half-Life[/i] a good game?[/b] It's decently made, but it's not the "best game ever" (Even ignoring that this is the Beta Dreamcast release). [b]Did I like [i]Half-Life[/i]?[/b] I liked some of what the game did, but no. [b]Did I enjoy [i]Half-Life[/i]?[/b] Yes, when the game wasn't being an FPS. [b]Overall,[/b] [i]Half Life[/i] feels like a meme. It's not a bad game, but I'm left wondering why this are still treating this like it was the "savior of gaming" 22 years later.

Comincia lento, ma neanche troppo, ci vuole poco per mettere le mani sopra il suo modesto armamentario, rispettivamente un’arma per ogni tipologia di nemico o situazione. Con la sua eterogeneità di bocche da fuoco e l’enorme Black Mesa, la varietà non ha una ruga nemmeno a volergli tirare le texture. L’unico grande difetto sono i movimenti di un motore vecchio cent’anni, dove sembra costantemente di correre scivolando in giro, rendendo molte sezioni platform un continuo quick-save e quick-load per non dover risalire l’ennesima scala o ritornare sulla giusta piattaforma.

C’è poco da dire su quello che viene riconosciuto come il capostipite degli fps narrativi: è sorprendentemente invecchiato bene a livello di gameplay, ed i piccoli enigmi alternano momenti in cui si cerca la strada giusta per proseguire e si sopravvivere alla grande quantità di nemici.
La grafica lascia un attimo interdetti per quanto riguarda la scelta di texture fin troppo identiche tra i percorsi esterni ed i suoi ambienti più grandi; Ma quello che mi ha veramente stancato sono gli scontri, dall’inizio alla fine è un salire continuo di sparatorie sempre più frequenti, con qualche raro momento più compassato e fin troppi nemici sulla nostra strada; Non lo ricordavo così denso ed estenuante.

Mi ha spiazzato l’immediatezza dell’azione, estremamente semplice, anche grazie ad una progressione quasi sempre lineare ma comunque encomiabile per un gioco con oltre vent’anni sulle spalle.
Non mi è dispiaciuto per niente, ma come varietà sicuramente con il seguito hanno impacchettato qualcosa più adatto al mio palato.

[b]8/10[/b]

- Per altre recensioni come questa: https://www.masterkamper.it/ -

The early levels are dense with character and intuitive puzzles. They make practical sense and are often interconnected with branching paths that are always worth exploring. These early levels encourage you to keep an eye on your surroundings as to not miss some loot, while keeping your other eye out for less welcome surprises, which are just as common.
Many games have tried to replicate this meaningful and engaging level design without fully understanding how exactly Half Life pulled it off.

The later levels are more of a chore. With the surprises from enemies and the environment seeming a bit less fair, and sometimes more on the tedious side, especially in the very last levels. The movement physics and platforming has not exactly aged well you might say... this game has avoided me beating it for many years, and I now remember why I'd find myself putting this down and playing something else back in the day, when I'd get far enough and the game loses some of its charm.

I do think everyone should play this game, but this isn't one I think everyone should force themselves to finish... because those parts of the game just aren't very fun... stupid aliens

I won't deny, there is SOME fun to be had with this game. However, there is no conceivable way to deny that the game is plagued by a myriad of issues that make a majority of the experience a slog at best. Movement is slippery and imprecise when the game requires platforming, physics are non-existent when puzzles need to be solved, and everything comes to a head in the final area where, without spoiling anything, the game requires a level of both precision and patience that most sane people just won't be able to manage after playing up to that point.

Ironically, it's a rather smooth experience despite these problems, with only a few crashes, bugs, and softlocks to be spoken of. Still, the thumbs-down at the top speaks for itself: this is not a game worth playing in 2020. If you absolutely must play this game, buckle down and spend the extra money on Black Mesa. Trust me, it will save your sanity.

Efsaneye selam durun! Zamanının FPS lideri, öncü, yenilikçi, harika bir oyun. Günümüz teknolojisine göre tabii ki hemen hemen her konudan geride kalmış olsa da bir döneme damgasını vurmuş ve kült olmayı başarmış bir baş yapıt. Grafikler artık göz bozacak seviyeye gelmiş bile olsa, hala oynamadıysanız mutlaka öneririm. Eski günleri anmak adına hala arada girip takıldığım bir oyun. Tavsiye ederim.

Sayısal değerlendirmem:

1.	Kullanıcı Arayüzü: 9/10
2.	Menü: 9/10
3.	Grafikler: 6/10
4.	Hikâye: 10/10
5.	Senaryo: 10/10
6.	Müzikler: 7/10
7.	Sahneler: 9/10
8.	Mekanik: 10/10
9.	SFX: 10/10
10.	Oynanış: 10/10

Toplam: 90/100 (70+/100 oyunları tavsiye ederim.)

its mark as a great game

Oh, Half-Life. What an amazing game. It's so misunderstood and seen as "an unforgiving game", "a very tough game" and "the hardest game in 1998 (debatable)", when in reality, it's just played incorrectly. Half-Life isn't just a shooting game with story, it's a strategy game with story. The game isn't just "run, shoot, die, reload, run, shoot, live", it's "run. think. shoot. live.", which is also the whole "phrase" of the retail game back in 1998; the phrase would be plastered almost everywhere on the game boxes. It's shocking the amount of people that just think the game is "oo I now have an SMG so I can use THAT instead of the shotgun to kill enemies!", it's more in-depth. Each gun, each purpose. Each enemy, each strategy. Each map, each way. The pistol is meant for mid-range attacks, when you're with enemies which aren't worth wasting your ammo on. The crowbar is great for melee; fast and powerful. The shotgun is for closer range attacks. The SMG is good for clearing out enemies at long range. The revolver is great for longer range enemies who need to be taken down quickly. I'm missing so many other weapons, but you get the point; running and shooting isn't all, thinking and living is another big part.

Bienvenido a mi primer reseña te doy las gracias de corazón por visitarme "Menor Qué tres"
||--------------------------------------------------||
||-----MI PUNTO DE VISTA-----||
Un gran juego que realmente vale la pena su inversión sobretodo cuando esta en descuento "guiño, guiño" para un juego de hace más de dos décadas y para tener todo ese tiempo encima no pierde su gracia 1998 - 2020 Y para lo poco que eh conocido la  saga de Half Life literalmente me ha enamorado. Y para las nuevas generaciones realmente espero que lo jueguen, se que los gráficos no son los mejores pero para su época fue toda una revolución gráfica aún así lo recomiendo totalmente.

||-----HISTORIA-----||
Es bastante buena su historia para ser un juego de disparos en primera persona, pero es mucho mejor que la averigües por ti mismo.  :)

||-----CONTROLES-----||
Este caso depende más de tus gustos, en mi propia experiencia me gustan pero no me terminan de convencer del todo porque me parecen algo sensibles. (Sobre todo en los saltos)

-Muchas gracias por leerlo y espero que te halla gustado.   XOXO
Postdata: espero que te sirva de algo.

||-----Aviso-----||

Jogo completinho.
O jogo demora um pouco  para desenvolver uma história e tem praticamente só dois personagens. Mesmo assim se sustentou no seu gameplay divertido, fluido e dinâmico (freeman parece um sonic de tão rápido). No geral a ambientação é ok, nada de inovador, e a trilha sonora é meio inexistente (mas colabora para o clima do jogo). Além disso me surpreendi com as mecânicas de puzzles e como o jogo não se preocupa em te orientar e facilitar.
Curti, o jogo é competente em vários pontos de vista e as expectativas para "Half Life 2" acabam de aumentar.
